HTML basics
HTML
How to format something in HTML

Preview

You can format your tutorial or comment with HTML, but what if you have never used HTML before? That's not a problem, because this tutorial will show you the basics of the HTML language, so you can format your text with using this tutorial. Good luck to your new tutorial!

HTML basics

Basic formatting stuff:
  • If you put something inside <b> and </b> than that text will be bold.
  • If you put something inside <i> and </i> than that text will be italic.
  • If you put something inside <u> and </u> than that text will be underlined.
Cool, but how can I change the size of the text? It's easy.

  • If you put something inside <h1> and </h1> than that text will be soooo big.

  • If you put something inside <h2> and </h2> than that text will be a bit smaller than the previous one.

  • If you put something inside <h3> and </h3> than that text will be a smaller.

  • etc. until <h6> (and don't forget to close it with </h6>!)
Now, you know how to change the size of the text, but if you hit enter, that new line will not appear in your tutorial, so you must use an HTML tag. Just use <br /> and you will add a new line.
But how can you add a horizontal line just like below? With </ hr>!
You can add lists to you tutorial. We're going to learn to types of list, the unordered and the ordered. If you want to create an unordered list than use <ul>, if you want to create an ordered list than <ol>.
For example, this is the code:
<ul>
     <li>First line!</li>
     <li>Second line!</li>
</ul>
And when you save it, it will transform to this:
  • First line!
  • Second line!
Another example, but this time it will be ordered list:
<ol>
     <li>First line!</li>
     <li>Second line!</li>
</ol>
Do you see? The only difference between the two code is the <ul> and <ol>, but this time this will happen:
  1. First line!
  2. Second line!
This is the difference between ordered (<ol>) and unordered (<ul>) list (and don't forget to close it with </ol> or </ul>!)
This was just the basics, but I think this enough to start your new tutorial and format it. If you know more about HTML (and even CSS) than feel free to use it within the tutorial.
Don't forget! This site is not use and registration system and it won't be, so after you save your tutorial you won't be able to edit it, so I highly recommend to use preview before you send it. :)
Have a good day!
